label: Or. 12.885, f081-1

metadata.label: Dimensions
metadata.value: Fragment 1: 12.7 × 10.6 cm; fragment 2: 4.7 × 3.7 cm; fragment 3: 3.2 × 1.5 cm

metadata.label: Condition
metadata.value: Badly preserved papyrus. Parts of the original document have been torn off on all sides; tears run through large parts of the largest fragment; the bottom of the recto is severely faded. The two minor fragments are very small. One contains a few letters; the other only the remnants of writing.

metadata.label: Further remarks
metadata.value: Or. 12885-81-1 contains three pieces of papyrus. The largest and smallest papyrus seem not to belong together: the scripts and the colour of these fragments do not match. The other small fragment may belong to the largest fragment, but this remains uncertain.

metadata.label: Content description
metadata.value:
Largest fragment:
The recto contains a private letter. The contents remain obscure. It mentions that someone’s need for something was explained (line 3: tafsīr mā yaḥtāj ilā). The letter further mentions two persons (line 4: ] b. Sulaymān and Muḥammad b. [) and that something had befallen on the sender (line 5: aṣabtu bihi). Line 6-8 are faded. In line 6, the phrase wakkala Muslim/Hishām b. [ or wa-kull muslim .. [ can be read.
The verso contains the end of a private letter. Closing formulae are found in line 2 (al-salām ʿa]layka wa-raḥmat allāh wa-barak[ātuhu). In line 3, the sender conveys greetings to the addressee on behalf of a third person (N.N. yuqriʾ ʿalay]ka al-salām kathīran). Lines 4 and 5 contain afterthoughts, expressing the wish that the addressee is nearby or that the sender receives a reply soon (line 4: wa-arjū an yakūna kitābuka min qarīb in shāʾa a[llāh).
